properties.areaDesc: Star Valley; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 14 at 2:33PM MST until February 16 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Significant Blowing Snow Today across portions of South Pass...

...Winter Storm Watch for Far Western Wyoming Saturday Night
through Sunday night...

.A combination of strong wind and fresh snow will result in
considerable blowing and drifting of snow across South Pass
through this evening. A strong storm system will likely bring
significant snow across far western Wyoming Saturday night through
Sunday evening.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Areas of blowing snow with
severely reduced visibility in the mountains.

* WHERE...Star Valley and Salt River and Wyoming Ranges.

* WHEN...From Saturday evening through Sunday evening.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...5 to 9 inches in Star Valley, and 10 to 16
inches in the mountains. Forecasted snow amounts could change
as the details of this winter storm become clearer.

* IMPACTS...Travel could become difficult. The reduced
visibility in snow and, or blowing snow can be very
disorientating for people recreating.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Please monitor the Bridger-Teton
Avalanche Center at JHAVALANCHE.ORG, if your plans include
travel into the back country.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING
